job_title: External Relations Officer in Chesterfield, MO
pros: The Admissions team is amazing. They are very supportive or growth and work hard to create a supportive and healthy work environment.
cons: Lots of travel with this position, but only some travel as an Admissions Coordinator or similar role.
Many Chiropractors who attended didn’t think benefitted at school enough to support fund raising

pros: Excellent Salary and Benefits Faculty are great to work with
cons: The administration can change its direction and vision at a moment's notice The administration does NOT communicate what is actually going on There is so much turnover at the top, things that were vitally important one day will be forgotten the next Zero accountability for the administration Employees are only valued if they can increase enrollment

pros: Easy work if you are just an adjunct filling in to help the lead professor.
cons:
Poor compensation for work done.
Overworked instructors and professors. 
Administrators are blind to faculty needs. 
Never enough budget for faculty but administration receive substantial raises.
Won’t hire adequate full time faculty.

pros: Logan has a beautiful location, friendly coworkers and takes excellence in health sciences, particularly Chiropractic, very seriously. Many folks have worked at Logan for 10+ years and have found a home there. The on-campus students are bright aspiring students in the chiropractic program. It is a nice environment and is looking to grow and modernize further.
cons: The school can be traditional from an operations perspective. As a smaller school it does not always have established processes for everything, but it is working on it.

job_title: Assistant Professor in Saint Louis, MO
cons: It’s academia things are always hush hush

job_title: Student Worker in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Flexible hours, Friendly staff, Great experience
cons: None that I can think of

Administrators say they are open to new ideas, but employees who share ideas outside the current procedures are thought of as being negative, even if a new process could benefit employees and/or students. Unethical actions taken by administrators, but employees who witness it and point out those actions are thought to not be a team player. Toxic environment for employees and students.

pros: Beautiful campus, nice to have cafe on site, some nice benefits. Nice to know you are helping students become educated.
cons: Many cons. Very political. Poor managers are allowed to stay even when everyone knows they are not doing a good job or empowering their employees. If they want someone out, they will find any reason to fire them.

Too much spending on showbiz, for example, one doesn't need big plasma screen TVs on the walls all over the campus...it's a waste of money...rather, spend that money on some merit-based scholarship for students to help them pay tuitions

pros: Administration has worked to make Logan a competitive workplace with competitive salaries and benefits.  Beautiful campus.  Great place to grow and continually improve.
cons: Change is hard and if you don't like change this won't be the right place for you.

pros: Top notch technology, respectable professors, clinicians and teachers and amazing campus.
cons: There is no cons. All has been great!
There really are none great place to work
